alert.note: Alert for Lewis; Mason (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 06 at 6:22PM EDT until May 06 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHWESTERN LEWIS, NORTHEASTERN MASON, SOUTHWESTERN ADAMS AND SOUTHEASTERN BROWN COUNTIES... At 622 PM EDT, the public reported flash flooding in southwest Adams county along State Route 41. Between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Maysville, Washington, West Union, Manchester, Ripley, Aberdeen, Dover, Bradysville, Trinity, Bentonville, Moranburg, South Ripley and Tuckahoe. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. To report flash flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
